description: Principles governing how intent is described and abstracted

principles.name: Descriptive, Not Prescriptive
principles.description: Intent rules describe what kind of choice was made, not whether it was good
constraints: Preferences are separate from rule generation

positive.rule: User adjusts text color for emphasis

negative.rule: User improves text color to better contrast

principles.name: Observable Grounding
principles.description: Every rule claim must be traceable to observable action data
constraints: No inferred motivations beyond observable patterns
Confidence reflects observability, not certainty of intent
Platform semantics constrain valid property/action references

positive.rule: User changes fill color from #FF0000 to #0000FF

negative.rule: User wants to convey trust through blue color
negative.why: Infers motivation not present in data

principles.name: Minimal Assumption (Occam's Razor)
principles.description: Prefer simpler explanations over complex ones
constraints: Single broad intent often better than multiple narrow ones
Don't over-segment intent when unified explanation suffices
Avoid inventing hidden structure not evident in trace

principles.name: Abstraction Consistency
principles.description: Maintain consistent abstraction level within a rule set
constraints: Don't mix hyper-specific and very general rules in same batch
Intermediate abstraction usually most useful for training
